manifest.author: Ben Hughes
manifest.name: Link Exploder
manifest.description: Link Exploder is a Obsidian plugin that creates a canvas from a note, embedding it's incoming (i.e. backlinks) and outgoing links onto the canvas (as well as the their linked notes).

manifest.author: Jeremy Overman
manifest.name: Slackify Note
manifest.description: Converts a note to a Slack-compliant markdown using [slackify-markdown](https://www.npmjs.com/package/slackify-markdown)

manifest.author: mbramani
manifest.name: YouTube Video Summarizer
manifest.description: Summarize YouTube videos using Gemini AI. Extract transcripts, generate summaries, and create structured notes.

manifest.author: onikun94
manifest.name: LINE Notes Sync
manifest.description: Sync messages from LINE to your notes.

manifest.author: Boninall
manifest.name: New Bullet With Time
manifest.description: Allows you to auto add current time to new bullet line.

manifest.author: @gapmiss
manifest.name: Badges
manifest.description: Add inline badges/callouts to notes.

manifest.author: make.md
manifest.name: make.md
manifest.description: make.md gives you everything you need to organize and personalize your notes.

manifest.author: Ellpeck
manifest.name: Custom Frames
manifest.description: A plugin that turns web apps into panes using iframes with custom styling. Also comes with presets for Google Keep, Todoist and more.

manifest.author: theopavlove
manifest.name: Dynamic Outline
manifest.description: Adds a customizable GitHub-like floating table of contents.

manifest.author: Michael Marvive
manifest.name: Citation Callouts
manifest.description: Elegantly formats quotes with citations from various sources into custom callouts.

manifest.author: caronchen
manifest.name: Calibre
manifest.description: This plugin allows you to access your calibre libraries and read books directly in Obsidian.

manifest.author: Michael J. Pedersen <m.pedersen@icelus.org>
manifest.name: Testing Vault
manifest.description: This allows a developer to make a random vault of arbitrary size for testing their plugins.

manifest.name: Query JSON
manifest.description: Read, query and work with JSON.

manifest.author: Charl Fourie
manifest.name: Journal Folder
manifest.description: Utilities for folder-based journaling

manifest.author: Yong
manifest.name: Class Relation Visualization
manifest.description: You can visualize your classes and their inheritance, composition, aggregation relation.

manifest.author: phibr0
manifest.name: Open with
manifest.description: This Plugin allows you to add multiple other programs to open notes with.

manifest.author: NothingIsLost
manifest.name: Dynamic Highlights
manifest.description: Dynamically highlight text based on cursor selection or search query with full regex, mobile, and live preview support

manifest.author: Nathan Clark
manifest.name: Page Gallery
manifest.description: Creates an embeddable gallery based on selected page contents.

manifest.author: Yeban
manifest.name: Note to RED
manifest.description: Convert Markdown notes to RED (Xiaohongshu) style images

manifest.author: tine-schreibt
manifest.name: aDHL
manifest.description: Create pretty static highlighters from search or regEx. Group by tag and set commands for toggling. Based on Dynamic Highlights.

manifest.name: Auto Close Tags

manifest.name: Code Preview

manifest.name: Todoist Sync
manifest.description: Materialize Todoist tasks within Obsidian notes.

manifest.author: Luke Hansford
manifest.name: Checklist Reset

manifest.author: Diego Viero
manifest.name: Syncthing status icon
manifest.description: Adds an icon in the status bar displaying Syncthing sync status. It shows a red circle if disconnected, green if connected, and yellow if scanning, not fully synced, or no device is connected. Provides detailed file completion and unsynced file counts, with a hover widget and custom view for more information.

manifest.description: Hide index files (folder notes) more reliably.
